message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for (MyClass myClass : myParser) {
    try {
        // .. do stuff ..
    } catch (Exception e) {
        // .. do exception stuff ..
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: Unfortunately, there is no way to handle exceptions directly within the foreach loop. The foreach loop implicitly calls Iterator.next(), but does not provide a mechanism to catch exceptions thrown by this method. You will need to handle exceptions within the body of the loop, as shown in the code snippet above.
